div.head: Nicholas Emanson. Will
div.p:
In the name of God amen. In the year of our Lord God 1670 March 20th
I Nicholas Emanson of Charles County in the province of Maryland being sick and
weak in body but of good and perfect memory thank be to god do make this my
last will and testament in manner and form following that is to say
first I bequeath my soul and into the hand of the almighty God my heavenly father
by u home of his and only grace I trust to be saved and n unto eternal
trust though the Death of my savior and redeemer Jesus Christ in whose precious
blood I sell the whole and only hope of my salvation my weathered body in hope
of a joyful resurrection I commit to the earth to be with such charge
and in such place as my Executor hereafter named shall think till and
touching the distribution of my mortall goods I disperse of the same a followith

list.item: First I will that all such Debts as I owe shall be truly paid.
Secondly I give unto my Daughter Phebe one thousand two hundred pounds of Tobacco to be paid to her or her heirs by my Executor hereafter named.

All of the rest of my Estate reall and pesonal lands goods cattles and chattels whatsoever I give and bequeath unto my loving wife Elizabeth and my Daughter Mary Emanson to be equally divided between them and my Daughter Marys share to be delivered unto her when she comes to be sixteen years of age

I will and ordaine that the part and portion of my Daughter Mary remain in the hands of my wife Elizabeth Emanson during the time of her minority and that my Executor out of the profits to be got by the use of the said Marys part or portion become die to her and if she dye before the said part or portion become due to her then the said part portion and legacy of her dying shall be all the disposal of my Executor.

div.p:
Lastly I make and ordaine the said Elizabeth Emanson my wife to be full hole and sole Executor of this my last will and testament by me in any waife heretofore made or declared I witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal the day
and
And year above written.
Signed sealed declared and Delivered [unclear] by the said [name]
Nicholas Emanson in the presents of
James Martin
Stephen Montague
William Marrit
Niel Emanson

Amended to and on the back of the aforegoing was the following &
endorsement by the 8th day of september 1671. Came the above named James Martin and made
oath that he saw the above named Nicholas Emanson sign seal deliver & publish
the above writing as his last will and testament and further that he was in
perfect sense and memory when he Executed the same sworn before me the day
and year above said.
Robert Ridgley

By virtue of a confirmation from the honorable Sr. William Talbot Baronett Chief Judge in
testamentary Causes within the province of Maryland hearing date the eighth
day of September in the 40th year of the Dominion of Celsius &c among Dom.
1671 to me directed and Im empowering to call before me the several
to the last will and testament of Nicholas Emanson late of Charles County deceased
that on the fourteenth day of Sept. in the year of our Lord 1671. Came before me
Stephen Montague and William Manill two of the witnesses to the within
written will and made oath that they saw the within mentioned Nicholas
Emanson sign seal and publish the within writing as his last will and testament
and further that he saw in present sense & memory when he did the same.
